titleStmt.title: By the Lords Justices, a proclamation for putting in execution the laws and statues of this realm, for the preventing the exportation of wooll, wooll-fells, woollen yarn, morthings, shorlings, wooll-flocks, fullers earth, fulling clay, and tobacco-pipe clay out of this kingdom.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Lords Justices.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Charles Bill, and the executrix of Thomas Newcomb ...,

notesStmt.note: "Given at Whitehall, the twenty ninth day of September, 1698, in the tenth year of His Majesties reign."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

person.persName: Charles Bill, and the executrix of Thomas Newcomb
